com.googlecode.lanterna.screen
Class Screen

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.lanterna.screen.Screen

public class Screen
extends Object

A layer to put on top of a Terminal object, giving you a kind of screen buffer to use, which is a lot easier to work with. Drawing text or graphics to the terminal is kind of like writing to a bitmap.

Author:
Martin

          Creates a new Screen on top of a supplied terminal, will query the terminal for its size.

Constructor Detail

Screen

public Screen(Terminal terminal)
Creates a new Screen on top of a supplied terminal, will query the terminal for its size. The screen is initially blank.

Parameters:
terminal -
Throws:
LanternaException

Screen

public Screen(Terminal terminal,
              TerminalSize terminalSize)
Creates a new Screen on top of a supplied terminal and will set the size of the screen to a supplied value. The screen is initially blank.

Parameters:
terminal -
terminalSize -

Screen

public Screen(Terminal terminal,
              int terminalWidth,
              int terminalHeight)
Creates a new Screen on top of a supplied terminal and will set the size of the screen to a supplied value. The screen is initially blank.

Parameters:
terminal -
terminalWidth - Width (number of columns) of the terminal
terminalHeight - Height (number of rows) of the terminal
Method Detail

getTerminal

public Terminal getTerminal()
Returns:
The terminal which is the backend for this screen

getCursorPosition

public TerminalPosition getCursorPosition()
Returns:
Position where the cursor will be located after the screen has been refreshed or null if the cursor is not visible

setCursorPosition

public void setCursorPosition(TerminalPosition position)
Moves the current cursor position or hides it. If the cursor is hidden and given a new position, it will be visible after this method call.

Parameters:
position - 0-indexed column and row numbers of the new position, or if null, hides the cursor

setCursorPosition

public void setCursorPosition(int column,
                              int row)
Moves the current cursor position, and if the cursor was hidden it will be visible after this call

Parameters:
column - 0-indexed column number of the new position
row - 0-indexed row number of the new position

setTabBehaviour

public void setTabBehaviour(TabBehaviour tabBehaviour)
Sets the behaviour for what to do about tab characters.

See Also:
TabBehaviour

getTabBehaviour

public TabBehaviour getTabBehaviour()
Gets the behaviour for what to do about tab characters.

See Also:
TabBehaviour

readInput

public Key readInput()
Reads the next Key from the input queue, or returns null if there is nothing on the queue.

getTerminalSize

public TerminalSize getTerminalSize()
Returns:
Size of the screen

startScreen

public void startScreen()
Calling this method will put the underlying terminal in private mode, clear the screen, move the cursor and refresh.

Throws:
LanternaException

stopScreen

public void stopScreen()
Calling this method will make the underlying terminal leave private mode, effectively going back to whatever state the terminal was in before calling startScreen()

Throws:
LanternaException

clear

public void clear()
Erases all the characters on the screen, effectively giving you a blank area. The default background color will be used, if you want to fill the screen with a different color you will need to do this manually.

putString

public void putString(int x,
                      int y,
                      String string,
                      Terminal.Color foregroundColor,
                      Terminal.Color backgroundColor,
                      ScreenCharacterStyle... styles)
Draws a string on the screen at a particular position

Parameters:
x - 0-indexed column number of where to put the first character in the string
y - 0-indexed row number of where to put the first character in the string
string - Text to put on the screen
foregroundColor - What color to use for the text
backgroundColor - What color to use for the background
styles - Additional styles to apply to the text

putString

public void putString(int x,
                      int y,
                      String string,
                      Terminal.Color foregroundColor,
                      Terminal.Color backgroundColor,
                      Set<ScreenCharacterStyle> styles)
Draws a string on the screen at a particular position

Parameters:
x - 0-indexed column number of where to put the first character in the string
y - 0-indexed row number of where to put the first character in the string
string - Text to put on the screen
foregroundColor - What color to use for the text
backgroundColor - What color to use for the background
styles - Additional styles to apply to the text

resizePending

public boolean resizePending()
This method will check if there are any resize commands pending. If true, you need to call refresh() to perform the screen resize

Returns:
true if the size is the same as before, false if the screen should be resized

refresh

public void refresh()
Call this method to make changes done through putCharacter(...), putString(...) visible on the terminal. The screen will calculate the changes that are required and send the necessary characters and control sequences to make it so.
